Course Description: THIS COURSE IS AN INTRODUCTION TO THE INTEGRATION OF TRADITIONAL ACCOUNTING CONCEPTS WITH COMPUTERIZED ACCOUNTING PROCEDURES IN OFFICE ENVIRONMENTS. SOFTWARE USED BY THE STUDENT WILL HANDLE THE GENERAL LEDGER, ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE, ACCOUNTS PAYABLE, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, PROCESSING OF PURCHASE ORDER AND SALES ORDERS, INVENTORY, FIXED ASSETS AND PAYROLL. COMPLETION OF THE COURSE QUALIFIES STUDENTS TO SIT FOR THE QUICKBOOKS CERTIFICATION EXAM.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
SET UP A COMPANY CHART OF ACCOUNTS IN QUICKBOOKS.
ENTER FINANCIAL TRANSACTIONS IN QUICKBOOKS.
PROCESS INVENTORY, BILLING, PAYMENTS AND PAYROLL IN QUICKBOOKS.
PERFORM BANK RECONCILIATIONS IN QUICKBOOKS.
PRODUCE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
Textbook(s): ULMER, COMPUTERIZED ACCOUNTING WITH QUICKBOOKS 2005, MCGRAW-HILL
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
